titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Reginald D. Woodcock papers, 1909-1977

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Ann Mulfort April 2013

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

bioghist.head: Biography of Reginald D. Woodcock
bioghist.p: Reginald D. Woodcock, an aviation historian, wrote a history of Thomas W. Benoist and the Benoist Airplane Company, "Benoist" in 1971.

Thomas Wesly Benoist (1874-1917) was an aviation pioneer who established a flying school and the Benoist Airplane Company, which produced biplanes in St. Louis in 1910. Benoist also founded the first commercial airline in the U.S., the St. Petersburg-Tampa Airboat Line, which made two daily flights between the two cities from January to March in 1914.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains materials relating to Woodcock's book on Benoist and aviation, including correspondence (1912-1977); subject and research files on aviation, the St. Petersburg-Tampa Airboat Line and Benoist (1915-1965); 3 scrapbooks on aviation, Benoist and the Benoist Airplane Company; miscellaneous maps (1918-1971); newspaper clippings (1909-1977); and photographs of Benoist and the Benoist Airplane Company.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Reginald D. Woodcock at the date of processing.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
